fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-64312].
  {panel}

h3. Summary

User unable to add a comment in an issue when the URL of the issue contains ** e.g https://<instance name>.atlassian.net/browse/<issue key>**
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 * Browse to any issue in a project and '**' at the end of the issue URL => [https://abcd.atlassian.net/browse/AB-6**]
 * The page will reload with '**' not being remove from the URL
 * Add a comment to the issue and an error message window will pop-up

h3. Expected Results
 * User to be able to add a comment to the issue regardless the URL contains '**' or not

h3. Actual Results
 * User not able to add comment when the URL contains '**'
  
h3. Workaround

 * Remove '**' from the URL and user should be able to add a comment
fields.summary: Unable to add comment when URL contains '**'
Include Other Fields in Mail Handler Configuration

fields.description:
h3. Summary
When using an Issue Collector, users without the *Create Attachment* permission can still attach files.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Setup an Issue Collector using the *Got feedback?* template
# Confirm the Project Permissions do not grant *Create Attachment* to anybody.
# Use the issue collector to submit an issue with an attachment.

h3. Expected Results
Creation would fail, or, if not fail at least not attach the file.

h3. Actual Results
New Issue is created with an attachment.
 
h3. Notes
Happens both when using default reporter or when trying to match user session.

h3.Workaround
Use the *Custom* template instead and omit the Attachment field.

If trying to reproduce the 'got feedback' emoji ratings input, you can roughly approximate this by defining a Custom Field to use instead.
fields.summary: Issue Collector does not respect Create Attachments permission
Components part of a ticket don't show on active sprint board
Nested groups documentation is confusing.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-64304].
  {panel}

We have a JIRA v7.3.2 install (sub-version #73013-sha1:3d53c97) with the visual/rich text editor enabled. The visual editor has caused frustration among my co-workers, as it encodes and displays literally text that we intended to be parsed as markdown or plug-in syntax (\{task\} for example). Unfortunately, the system defaults to Visual mode, and I can’t find a way to set it to default as Text. I notice that the Atlassian JIRA (which seems to be running v7.3.0 sub-version 73011-sha1:3202aba:node1) defaults to Text. I also understand that previous versions only had Text mode with a Preview button, which seems like a much better solution because there’s no chance of text transforming in unwanted ways when switching between what should be edit and preview modes.

We would like one or more of these options:
* Turn off the visual editor and use the old editor with Preview button.
* If the system has the visual editor enabled, choose whether to display text or visual mode by default.

These should be configurable by each user. If you want to provide a site/install-wide setting, fine, but the user should have the option to override in case the sysadmins choose the wrong one.
fields.summary: Visual Editor-enabled JIRA should allow users to default to text mode (via preference or just remembering last used mode)
Update to JIRA Core Labs Documentation Needed

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-64302].
  {panel}

*PROBLEM*
When using the JIRA cardwall, stories move across the status columns as the progress from new work to completed work. Users drag the cards from left to right during that progression. For an organization that has multiple "done" statuses (DONE, REJECTED / WON'T FIX, DUPLICATE, etc), all of those statuses appear in the "Done" column as you drag a card into that last status. The column is then divided into equal parts, vertically, with all of the available DONE statuses. The user is supposed to drag into the right DONE area for that story. 

The main problem with this approach is that most of the time, we really want to mark a story as Done or Completed. We almost never drag one into rejected, dup, etc. However, as testers are rushing to get through work at the end of a sprint, very often they drag a story into the wrong done status. This creates confusion and additional overhead on checking in with the team to confirm they meant DONE not REJECTED, etc. I find this to be one of the most irritating UX aspects to the cardwall.

 

*SUGGESTION*

Make dragging a story into the final "done" column easier to mark "DONE" instead of the myriad other statuses that share this visual space.
fields.summary: Improve UX of marking stories DONE on the cardwall

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-64301].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition

It's no longer possible to create users with duplicated email addresses.

The instances that have duplicated email addresses are not able to import into other instances without updating the users.

 

h3. Suggested Solution

Allow the creation of users with duplicated email addresses, or skip the email validation during import.

 

h3. Why this is important

Some companies are unable to create an e-mail address for each user and so they need to create users with duplicated mail addresses

 

h3. Workaround (Optional)
fields.summary: Allow users with duplicated email address

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
*NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-64300].
{panel}
Right now, JIRAs REST API for update creation (see [REST update project|https://docs.atlassian.com/jira/REST/server/#api/2/project-updateProject] ) does not allow to configure all the relevant schemes.

—

The following overview illustrates this: 
||REST Update Project attribute||supported||
|issueSecurityScheme|(/) can be set|
|permissionScheme|(/) can be set|
|notificationScheme|(/) can be set|
|workflowScheme|(/) can be set|
|issueTypeScheme|(/) can be set|
|issueTypeScreenScheme|(x) can not be set|
|fieldConfigurationScheme|(x) can not be set|

—

Workaround:

JIRA CLI Plugin can also update projects via scripting with flexibility of setting the schemes:
 [https://bobswift.atlassian.net/wiki/display/JCLI/Reference#Reference-updateProject]
fields.summary: JIRA REST API: update project should allow to set all relevant schemes

{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-64299].
  {panel}

After some research around the FIlter Shared to Public, I found the JRA-23255, which mentions that new Settings are available in order allow or not to share Filter to Public, and make the difference between "Public" and "Logged In User".

Ok, it covers a part of the issue.

Is normal that, when an anonymous access list all Filters Shared to Public, it is possible to have have the name and login of the Filter's Owner.

The Question is more relevant when :
 * the JIRA Instance is in Private Mode
 * And the Browse Users Global Permission is granted to all groups.

In such case, the Owner should be not hidden.

Vincent
fields.summary: Shared Filter Owners should be not visible to anonymous access

fields.description:
h5. Issue Summary

When a user connects JIRA to Fisheye/Crucible and sets the workflow conditions:
* No open Commit
* No review changeset

to any of the transitions, if the review search method is set to *Related Commits*, JIRA would not obey the conditions set in the workflows and make the transition available to users even when the condition shave not been fulfilled.

h5. Steps to Reproduce

# Connect JIRA to Fisheye/Crucible via Application Link.
# Create a JIRA Software Development project.
# Modify the *Done* transition(any transition can be used) and add the conditions:
#- _No Open Crucible Reviews_.
#- _No unreviewed changeset_ 
# Publish the Workflow changes.
# Create an issue in JIRA.
# In crucible, push a commit to to the issue created.
# Add a review to the commit and leave it open.
# Go back to JIRA and refresh the issue page.
# You should notice that the done button is removed.
# Go to the *Fisheye* page in JIRA.
# Edit the review search method and change it from *Both* (default) to *Related Commits*
# Go back to the JIRA issue.
# Refresh the page.

h5. Expected Behavior

The Done transition button would not be present since there is a commit related to the issue.

h5. Actual Behavior

The Done button would be present and the transition can be performed despite there being open review related to the issue and also there being a changeset.

For more information, have a look at the images below:

 !screenshot-1.png|thumbnail! 

 !screenshot-2.png|thumbnail! 

 !screenshot-3.png|thumbnail! 

h5. Workaround

Revert the review search method to use *Both*
fields.summary: JIRA Does not Respect Workflow Condition From Crucible

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-64297].
  {panel}

I have modified a standard workflow "Software Simplified Workflow" and made one status ("In Review" in my example) unreachable. 
However the REST method "/jira/rest/projectconfig/1/workflow" still returns a JSON data that does not reflect this change: "In Review" status still exists there and has no principal difference with other statuses.
My problem is I have no way to check if it is actually available to switch to or not.
I suppose one of following solutions:
1. Remove unreachable states from JSON.
or
2. Mark unreachable states in JSON as disabled.
or
3. Mark the states that have transitions from "All" states with an appropriate tag.
fields.summary: Need an improvement in "/jira/rest/projectconfig/1/workflow" method.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-64296].
  {panel}

As of JIRA Software 7.2.3 the Fix Version drop down on the issue screen only searches for typed text starting from the beginning of a whole word in a fix version. It would be nice if the list possibilities would be populated by versions which contained the input string in any part of the version. This behavior would be similar to how Bitbucket Server is able to populate a drop down list of branches matching the input text to any part of the branch name.

Example:

Say I have fix versions "hello1", "hello2", and "hello3" in my project. If I type "1" into the fix version field in an issue, currently the list possibilities will be empty and will only suggest that I can make a new fix version called "1". The desired behavior would be that the list possibilities contain "hello1" because the string "1" is contained in that fix version. 

The lack of more powerful searching in this drop down becomes a problem when a project has many versions, the version strings are long, and the characters that differentiate the versions are found at the end of a whole word so many characters must be typed before the desired version shows up as one of the top results in the drop down list.
fields.summary: Better searching in fix version dropdown on issue screen
Ability to change subject line on outgoing email type

h3. Problem Definition
While on 'Basic' search, the 'Label' field should show as 'Labels' to be consistent with the rest of the application. 

h3. Suggested Solution
Rename the system field to 'Labels' in Basic Search

h3. Why this is important
The system field is named 'Labels', so it causes confusion when the field is rendered as 'Label' in Basic Search.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Install a vanilla 7.1.6 or newer instance
# Go to JIRA's basic search
# Notice the 'Labels' field is rendered as 'Label'
fields.summary: While on 'Basic' search, the 'Label' field should show as 'Labels' to be consistent with the system field/rest of the application

No response occurs as if the buttons are not selectable

fields.description:
h3. Summary
* When the Operating System language is set to Turkish, after installation or upgrade of JIRA 7, the startup will fail with all a JiraLockedError page.
* You can see all plugins are disabled in the database (both user and system) from the logs:
{code} ___ FAILED PLUGIN REPORT _____________________
    
    191 plugins failed to load during JIRA startup.
    {code}

h3. Environment
* JIRA 7 instance
* OS language is set to Turkish

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Switch the OS Language to Turkish
# Install/Upgrade JIRA and start it up afterwards.

h3. Expected Results
# JIRA will startup normally without any issues.

h3. Actual Results
# A JiraLockedError page is shown in the UI.
# The below exception is thrown in the atlassian-jira.log file:
{noformat}
2015-12-02 19:38:14,665 FelixDispatchQueue ERROR      [c.a.p.o.container.felix.FelixOsgiContainerManager] Framework error in bundle org.eclipse.gemini.blueprint.extender

	at org.springframework.beans.factory.parsing.FailFastProblemReporter.error(FailFastProblemReporter.java:70)

{noformat}

# The current workaround for this issue would be to change the operating system language from Turkish to English then restart the server and start JIRA again.
# If changing OS Language is not an option, you can also add the {{-Duser.language=en}} parameter to your startup properties as mentioned in [Setting properties and options on startup.|https://confluence.atlassian.com/adminjiraserver070/setting-properties-and-options-on-startup-749383528.html]

fields.description:
h3. Summary

!log-detail.png!

Login details is not updated on SAML login. 

h3. Environment
* JIRA 7.3.0
* SAML

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Configure JIRA with SAML authentication
# Login to JIRA through SAML
# Notice that the Login Details indicate as "Never logged in"

h3. Expected Results

The Login Details should be updated.

h3.Workaround
None
fields.summary: Login details is not updated on SAML login

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-64281].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition
Currently it isn't clear in the [Workflow Properties|https://confluence.atlassian.com/adminjiraserver071/workflow-properties-802592825.html] documentation what [permissions|https://developer.atlassian.com/jiradev/jira-platform/jira-architecture/authentication/available-permissions] are available. 
h3. Suggested Solution
Please update the documentation with [available permissions|https://developer.atlassian.com/jiradev/jira-platform/jira-architecture/authentication/available-permissions]. 
h3. Why this is important
 Makes it easer and no user friction trying to dig for the information in developers.
fields.summary: Update workflow property documentation in regards to available permissions

fields.description:
h3. Summary
If a user clicks the reset password function with no outgoing mail configured. Customer will still recieve the following message:

"Your password is sent"

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Install JIRA do not configure an outgoing mail server.
# Reset password.

h3. Expected Results
An error message indicating no mail server is configured. 
h3. Actual Results
A message is received "Your password is reset" even though there is no outgoing mail server configured.
fields.summary: User will receive password reset and mail sent with no outgoing mail server configured.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-64279].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition

Its not obvious from the documentation how to enable/disable the share functionality for specific users:
 * [Editing and collaborating on issues|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRACORESERVER073/Editing+and+collaborating+on+issues]
 * [Managing global permissions|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/AdminJIRAServer072/Managing+global+permissions]

The *global permissions* screen does however mention this, but you would have to know it would be a *global permission* in the first place to get that far

!Screen Shot 2017-03-01 at 2.58.32 PM.png!
h3. Suggested Solution
 * Add a note about the *Browse User* global permission in the share section of the [Editing and collaborating on issues|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRACORESERVER073/Editing+and+collaborating+on+issues] documentation
 * Add a note about the share feature (as exist in the global permission screen already) to the [Managing global permissions|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/AdminJIRAServer072/Managing+global+permissions] documentation
fields.summary: Add note about global Browse Users permission to Share issue documentation.

fields.description:
h3. Summary
In some rare cases, JIRA has consistency problems with CustomFields, this will lead to *NullPointerException* in {{getFieldConfig}} method. 
And that could lead to other problems related to ProjectSidebarRenderer not able to load the data. 

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create CF data inconsistency  
# Create Filter containing CF using values from inconsistent data 
# Load any issue 

h3. Expected Results
JIRA works fine.

h3. Actual Results
JIRA can't render sidebar: *Unable to render element due to an error*

The below exception is thrown in the jira logs:
{noformat}
Caused by: java.lang.NullPointerException
	at com.atlassian.jira.issue.fields.config.persistence.FieldConfigPersisterImpl.getFieldConfig(FieldConfigPersisterImpl.java:170)
	at com.atlassian.jira.issue.fields.config.manager.FieldConfigManagerImpl.getFieldConfig(FieldConfigManagerImpl.java:30)
	at com.atlassian.jira.issue.customfields.option.LazyLoadedOption$1.create(LazyLoadedOption.java:31)
	at com.atlassian.jira.issue.customfields.option.LazyLoadedOption$1.create(LazyLoadedOption.java:28)
	at com.atlassian.util.concurrent.LazyReference$Sync.run(LazyReference.java:325)
	at com.atlassian.util.concurrent.LazyReference.get(LazyReference.java:112)
	at com.atlassian.jira.issue.customfields.option.LazyLoadedOption.getRelatedCustomField(LazyLoadedOption.java:42)
	at com.atlassian.jira.plugins.issue.create.context.fields.helpers.SelectableCustomCFTypeJQLMapper$$anonfun$filterOnlyRelevantOptions$1$$anonfun$apply$1$$anonfun$apply$2$$anonfun$apply$3.apply(SelectableCustomCFTypeJQLMapper.scala:19)
	at com.atlassian.jira.plugins.issue.create.context.fields.helpers.SelectableCustomCFTypeJQLMapper$$anonfun$filterOnlyRelevantOptions$1$$anon
...
	at com.atlassian.jira.plugins.issue.create.context.fields.helpers.GenericClauseInputMapper$class.apply(GenericClauseInputMapper.scala:15)
	at com.atlassian.jira.plugins.issue.create.context.fields.custom.SelectCFTypeJQLMapper.apply(SelectCFTypeJQLMapper.scala:13)
...
	at com.atlassian.jira.plugins.issue.create.context.InputParamsBuilder.contextForPossibleValues(InputParamsBuilder.scala:99)
	at com.atlassian.jira.plugins.issue.create.rest.ContextResolutionHelper.possibleValuesForClause(ContextResolutionHelper.scala:48)
	at com.atlassian.jira.plugins.issue.create.rest.ContextResolutionHelper.possibleValuesForIssueInput(ContextResolutionHelper.scala:55)
	at com.atlassian.greenhopper.service.query.FieldPossibleValuesAdapterImpl.possibleValuesForIssueInput(FieldPossibleValuesAdapterImpl.java:21)
	at com.atlassian.greenhopper.service.query.FieldPossibleValues.getProjectIdsForQuery(FieldPossibleValues.java:38)
...
	at com.atlassian.greenhopper.service.query.QueryToProjectMapper.getProjectContextIdsForQuery(QueryToProjectMapper.java:78)
	at com.atlassian.greenhopper.service.query.QueryServiceImpl.getProjectsForRapidView(QueryServiceImpl.java:123)
	at com.atlassian.greenhopper.service.query.QueryServiceImpl.getExplicitProjectsForRapidViewFilterQuery(QueryServiceImpl.java:110)
	at com.atlassian.greenhopper.service.rapid.ProjectRapidViewServiceImpl.findProjectsByRapidView(ProjectRapidViewServiceImpl.java:69)
	at com.atlassian.greenhopper.service.rapid.ProjectRapidViewServiceImpl.findRapidViewsByProject(ProjectRapidViewServiceImpl.java:51)
	at com.atlassian.greenhopper.web.sidebar.ProjectBoardsHelper.getProjectBoards(ProjectBoardsHelper.java:53)
	at com.atlassian.greenhopper.web.sidebar.BoardScopeFilterContextProviderImpl.getContext(BoardScopeFilterContextProviderImpl.java:47)
	at com.atlassian.jira.projects.context.ProjectContextPopulatorImpl.populateWithProject(ProjectContextPopulatorImpl.java:82)
	at com.atlassian.jira.projects.sidebar.footer.ProjectAdminLinkService.getProjectConfigUrlOverride(ProjectAdminLinkService.java:90)
	at com.atlassian.jira.projects.sidebar.footer.ProjectAdminLinkService.getAdminUrl(ProjectAdminLinkService.java:75)
	at com.atlassian.jira.projects.sidebar.footer.ProjectAdminLinkService.getLinkForProject(ProjectAdminLinkService.java:57)
	at com.atlassian.jira.projects.sidebar.ProjectSidebarRendererImpl.render(ProjectSidebarRendererImpl.java:102)
...
{noformat}
 
h3. Notes
Possibly caused by JRA-19422, which was fixed in JIRA 4.0.1.
Problem: When deleting a custom field context for a select custom field, the options created are not deleted. They remain in the {{customfieldoption}} table, with references to a {{fieldconfiguration}} (custom field context) that no longer exists (because it was deleted).

The table structure for involved tables: fieldconfigschemeissuetype, fieldconfiguration, fieldconfigscheme, customfieldoption
* {{fieldconfigschemeissuetype.fieldconfiguration}} maps to {{fieldconfiguration.id}}
* {{fieldconfigschemeissuetype.fieldconfigscheme}} maps to {{fieldconfigscheme.id}}
* {{customfieldoption.customfieldconfig}} maps to {{fieldconfiguration.id}}

You can check data consistency by running followings SQLs
{code:borderStyle=solid}
// Check orphaned records in fieldconfiguration vs fieldconfigschemeissuetype 
select fc.id from fieldconfiguration fc left join fieldconfigschemeissuetype fcsit on (fc.id = fcsit.fieldconfiguration) where fcsit.id is null order by fc.id;

// Check orphaned records in fieldconfigschemeissuetype vs  fieldconfiguration 
select fcsit.id,fcsit.fieldconfiguration from fieldconfigschemeissuetype fcsit left join fieldconfiguration fc on (fc.id = fcsit.fieldconfiguration) where fc.id is NULL;

// Check orphaned records in customfieldoption vs fieldconfiguration 
select distinct(customfieldconfig) from customfieldoption where customfieldconfig not in (select id from fieldconfiguration );
{code}
They should return 0 records in normal condition. 

h3.Workaround
See KBs:
* https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRAKB/Error+when+searching+for+issues+or+loading+a+filter+involving+a+particular+custom+field
* [Error .. due to Dead References on Cascading Select custom field|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRAKB/Error+thrown+when+accessing+or+creating+JIRA+Agile+board+due+to+Dead+References+on+Cascading+Select+custom+field]
fields.summary: NullPointerException in getFieldConfig

fields.description:
h3. Summary

While attaching screenshot using the "CTRL + V" shortcut, JIRA throws the "The issue no longer exists." error.

Steps to reproduce the error:

# Go to issue navigator.
# Click on any filter. Eg: "Viewed recently"
# Ensure that issue is shown in "Detail view".
# Click on any issue. Ensure that the comment box is set to text mode.
# Take any screenshot and use the "CTRL + V" shortcut in the comment box. The screenshot will be added. Cancel the action and click outside the comment box.
# Try to use "CTRL + V" shortcut in the comment box again to attach the screenshot. 
# "The issue no longer exists." error will be shown.

h3. Environment

JIRA 7.2.7, JIRA 7.3.0, JIRA 7.3.1


h3. Expected Results

Attachment attached without any error.


h3. Actual Results

Attachment not added and JIRA throws the "The issue no longer exists." error.


h3.Workaround

# Attach the attachment by opening the new in individual issue page view.
# Refresh the page and attach the screenshot using the "CTRL + V" shortcut again.
fields.summary: Attachment "The issue no longer exists." error

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-64274].

fields.description:
h3. Summary
 # When a node is removed from JIRA Data Center, it is not possible to login for about 5-10 minutes.
 # A use case of node removal is when AWS Auto Scaling Group (ASG) is used where nodes are added or removed as the overall load increases or decreases.

h3. Environment
 # Using the [Cloud Formation (CF) templates from Atlassian/AWS|https://aws.amazon.com/quickstart/architecture/jira] to setup a JIRA data center environment in AWS.
 # Reference: [JIRA Software and JIRA Service Desk Data Center on the AWS Cloud|https://s3.amazonaws.com/quickstart-reference/atlassian/jira/latest/doc/jira-software-data-center-on-the-aws-cloud.pdf].

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Setup JIRA Data Center in AWS.
 # Ensure to have more than 3 nodes configured for Minimum number of cluster nodes.
 !screenshot-2.png|thumbnail!
 # Wait for all the nodes to be alive from the System Info page on JIRA:
 !screenshot-3.png|thumbnail!
 # Update the Cluster nodes to have 2 Minimum and Maximum 2 nodes:
 !screenshot-1.png|thumbnail!
 # Check the CloudFormation page to ensure that the status shows UPDATE_COMPLETE.
 !screenshot-4.png|thumbnail!
 # Check if the nodes are being removed from the System Info page on JIRA. Only 2 nodes should be *Alive*.

h3. Expected Results
 # Users should be able to log in.
 # Existing users should not be logged out when nodes are being removed.

h3. Actual Results
 # Users are unable to login JIRA for about 5-10 mins.
 # Getting the error that the username or password is invalid.
 # Existing users get logged out of JIRA.
 # The below exception is thrown in the atlassian-jira.log file:
{noformat}
2017-03-01 11:23:30,330 http-nio-8080-exec-19 WARN anonymous 683x44x2 ju0bau 211.25.18.162,10.0.141.167 /login.jsp [c.a.j.cluster.distribution.JiraCacheManagerPeerProvider] Looking up rmiUrl //ip-10-0-55-196:40001/com.atlassian.jira.avatar.CachingTaggingAvatarStore.avatars threw a connection exception. This could mean that a node has gone offline  or it may indicate network connectivity difficulties. Details: Exception creating connection to: ip-10-0-55-196; nested exception is: 
    	java.net.NoRouteToHostException: No route to host
2017-03-01 11:23:39,594 http-nio-8080-exec-10 WARN anonymous 683x60x2 ju0bau 211.25.18.162,10.0.141.167 /rest/gadget/1.0/login [c.a.j.cluster.distribution.JiraCacheManagerPeerProvider] Looking up rmiUrl //ip-10-0-35-163:40001/com.atlassian.jira.crowd.embedded.ofbiz.EagerOfBizUserCache.userCache threw a connection exception. This could mean that a node has gone offline  or it may indicate network connectivity difficulties. Details: Exception creating connection to: ip-10-0-35-163; nested exception is: 
    	java.net.NoRouteToHostException: No route to host
2017-03-01 11:23:42,598 http-nio-8080-exec-10 WARN anonymous 683x60x2 ju0bau 211.25.18.162,10.0.141.167 /rest/gadget/1.0/login [c.a.j.cluster.distribution.JiraCacheManagerPeerProvider] Looking up rmiUrl //ip-10-0-55-196:40001/com.atlassian.jira.crowd.embedded.ofbiz.EagerOfBizUserCache.userCache threw a connection exception. This could mean that a node has gone offline  or it may indicate network connectivity difficulties. Details: Exception creating connection to: ip-10-0-55-196; nested exception is: 
    	java.net.NoRouteToHostException: No route to host
2017-03-01 11:24:04,350 Caesium-1-2 WARN ServiceRunner     [c.a.j.cluster.distribution.JiraCacheManagerPeerProvider] Looking up rmiUrl //ip-10-0-35-163:40001/com.atlassian.jira.plugins.healthcheck.service.HeartBeatService.heartbeat threw a connection exception. This could mean that a node has gone offline  or it may indicate network connectivity difficulties. Details: Exception creating connection to: ip-10-0-35-163; nested exception is: 
    	java.net.NoRouteToHostException: No route to host
2017-03-01 11:24:07,354 Caesium-1-2 WARN ServiceRunner     [c.a.j.cluster.distribution.JiraCacheManagerPeerProvider] Looking up rmiUrl //ip-10-0-55-196:40001/com.atlassian.jira.plugins.healthcheck.service.HeartBeatService.heartbeat threw a connection exception. This could mean that a node has gone offline  or it may indicate network connectivity difficulties. Details: Exception creating connection to: ip-10-0-55-196; nested exception is: 
    	java.net.NoRouteToHostException: No route to host
2017-03-01 11:25:37,666 http-nio-8080-exec-19 WARN anonymous 683x44x2 ju0bau 211.25.18.162,10.0.141.167 /login.jsp [c.a.j.cluster.distribution.JiraCacheManagerPeerProvider] Looking up rmiUrl //ip-10-0-30-161:40001/com.atlassian.jira.avatar.CachingTaggingAvatarStore.avatars threw a connection exception. This could mean that a node has gone offline  or it may indicate network connectivity difficulties. Details: Connection refused to host: ip-10-0-30-161; nested exception is: 
{noformat}
 

h3. Root cause

Ehcache in JIRA DC is not informed about node being removed from the cluster. As a result for about 5 minutes all nodes in the cluster will try to invalidate cache on not existing host. Resolving host name that is not existing is much slower than for existing host, this is why this problem is occurring.

In order to prevent this from happening first shut down JIRA, wait 5-10 minutes and then terminate the host itself.
h3. Notes
 * Issue is reproducible when the node is removed by ASG or removed/terminated manually.
 * This not only affects AWS but also generic Data Center environments when host DNS name becomes unavailable.

h3. Workaround

For AWS, do not use Auto Scaling Group by configuring the Minimum number of cluster nodes *identical* to the Maximum number of cluster nodes.
fields.summary: Removing Data Center node breaks JIRA login for around 10 minutes

h3. Summary

When using text effects in the middle of a word (like aaa{*}bbb{*}ccc) from the toolbar, the word is not marked up correctly.

When it comes to Non-English languages like Japanese, one sentence is composed *without* space character (as if it is a word) in general.

e.g.) The following sentences have the same meanings.
* English : I'm working for Atlassian. (There are some space character in the sentence)
* Japanese : 私は、アトラシアンで働いています。(There are no space character in the sentence)

When it comes to the Japanese one, If you want to make the word "アトラシアン" bold, we need to use text effects in the middle of the word (I meant the sentence *without* space character).

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Open an issue
# Open the editor in the description field (comment field is also fine)
# Type "aaabbbccc" in the editor
# Try to make the part "bbb" of the word bold from the toolbar
# The word "aaabbbccc" is marked up as "aaa*bbb*ccc"
# Preview the description field (or comment field)

h3. Expected Results

For now, we can escape the special characters which are used for the text effects with "{}".
Then, the word "aaabbbccc" should be marked up as "aaa\{\*\}bbb\{\*\}ccc". (It was shown as "aaa{*}bbb{*}ccc".)

h3. Actual Results

As I described in the above, the word was converted to "aaa*bbb*ccc" and there was no text effect on the word. (It was shown as "aaa*bbb*ccc".)

h3.Workaround

Just type the mark up manually.
fields.summary: When using text effects in the middle of a word, the word is not marked up correctly

{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
*NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-64255].
{panel}
h3. Summary

(!) This is not a JIRA bug, but the placeholder ticket for JVM problem. Main goal is to track the problem on our side.
 Periodically JVM crashes with following error:
{code:java}
#  SIGSEGV (0xb) at pc=0x00007f36c1177ae2, pid=26874, tid=0x00007f36a79da700
#
# JRE version: Java(TM) SE Runtime Environment (8.0_101-b13) (build 1.8.0_101-b13)
# Java VM: Java HotSpot(TM) 64-Bit Server VM (25.101-b13 mixed mode linux-amd64 compressed oops)
# Problematic frame:
# V  [libjvm.so+0x5c3ae2]  G1ParScanThreadState::copy_to_survivor_space(InCSetState, oopDesc*, markOopDesc*)+0x1d2

...
Stack: [0x00007f36a78da000,0x00007f36a79db000],  sp=0x00007f36a79d9410,  free space=1021k
Native frames: (J=compiled Java code, j=interpreted, Vv=VM code, C=native code)
V  [libjvm.so+0x5c3ae2]  G1ParScanThreadState::copy_to_survivor_space(InCSetState, oopDesc*, markOopDesc*)+0x1d2
V  [libjvm.so+0x5c450b]  G1ParScanThreadState::trim_queue()+0x4ab
V  [libjvm.so+0x59ed17]  G1ParEvacuateFollowersClosure::do_void()+0x27
V  [libjvm.so+0x5aa923]  G1ParTask::work(unsigned int)+0x463
V  [libjvm.so+0xae5a6f]  GangWorker::loop()+0xcf
V  [libjvm.so+0x924698]  java_start(Thread*)+0x108
{code}
This is internal JVM error in *G1ParScanThreadState* code.
h3. Environment
 * Oracle 8u101
 ** Java HotSpot(TM) 64-Bit Server VM (25.101-b13) for linux-amd64 JRE (1.8.0_101-b13)

h3. Notes
There are some bugs open for this in Java bug tracker: 
* https://bugs.openjdk.java.net/browse/JDK-8143310
* https://bugs.openjdk.java.net/browse/JDK-8170451 

But unfortunately, they are closed as _Cannot Reproduce_. 
Commend from Oracle team: 
bq. This can be caused by any bug that corrupts heap memory. It could be an issue with GC, with the compiler, with bad native code... 
 
We have had success in preventing this bug from occurring in previous support cases by determining the source of frequent Full GCs and fixing the underlying problem, reducing the frequency of Full GCs

h3. Workaround
Restart JVM/Jira
fields.summary: jvm crash  G1ParScanThreadState::copy_to_survivor_space

fields.description:
h2. Summary
There is a scenario where JIRA during start up detects that there is a gap between the issues in the database and the indexed issues (lucene's indexes), if that gap is lower than 24 hours the start up thread starts a a single-threaded reindex (Recover Issue Index) blocking any other threads and hence making the reindex slower and blocking any users connections to JIRA.
It is important to note that this process only happens during the start up.


h2. Environment
I reproduced it in version 6.4.13 as well as version 7.2.


h2. Steps to Reproduce
# Start up JIRA
# Mark log file "Recover Issue Index Test Start"
# Create a new project
# Insert 1000 issues to the new project
# Goto System>>Advanced>>Indexing>>Index Recovery and enable it
# Create a new backup for the indexes
# Insert 10000 new issues (please note it can be less than 10000, I used 10000 issues as it gave me more time to probe that blocks any other sessions)
# Stop JIRA
# Goto JIRA_HOME/caches/indexes and copy all directories to a temp directory so you have a backup
# Delete all the directories in  JIRA_HOME/caches/indexes
# Copy the backup generated in step 6 from JIRA_HOME/export/indexsnapshots/ and unzip it to JIRA_HOME/caches/indexes
# Start up JIRA
# Mark log file "Recover Issue Index Test 2 End"
# Check the log files



h2. Expected Results

If the start up thread kicks off a reindex and blocks any other users I would expect the process to be multi-threaded.  Ideally, the customer would be able to configure what type of reindex process they would like to have in this situation by choosing either a background reindex (single threaded and nonblocking) or foreground re-index (multi-threaded, but blocking) using a property.  I have created a separate feature request for this.

h2. Actual Results
The start up thread kicks off a reindex process that blocks any other threads and is single-threaded.


h2.Workaround
There is no workaround.


h2. Additional Information

h3. Start of the process in the log file
{code}
2017-02-11 13:00:31,540 localhost-startStop-1 INFO [atlassian.jira.scheduler.JiraSchedulerLauncher] Starting the JIRA Scheduler....
2017-02-11 13:00:31,596 localhost-startStop-1 INFO [atlassian.jira.scheduler.JiraSchedulerLauncher] JIRA Scheduler started.
2017-02-11 13:00:33,215 localhost-startStop-1 INFO [jira.index.ha.DefaultIndexRecoveryManager] Latest index date: {2017-02-11 12:29:49}, Latest DB date: {2017-02-11 12:53:06}
2017-02-11 13:00:33,220 localhost-startStop-1 INFO [atlassian.jira.startup.IndexRecoveryLauncher] Recover Issue Index - start
2017-02-11 13:00:33,692 localhost-startStop-1 DEBUG [jira.issue.index.DefaultIssueDocumentFactory] Indexing issue: STP-14998
2017-02-11 13:00:33,964 localhost-startStop-1 DEBUG [jira.issue.index.DefaultIssueDocumentFactory] Indexing issue: STP-14997
2017-02-11 13:00:34,002 localhost-startStop-1 DEBUG [jira.issue.index.DefaultIssueDocumentFactory] Indexing issue: STP-1499
{code}

h3. End of the process in the log files
{code}
2017-02-11 13:04:10,745 localhost-startStop-1 DEBUG [jira.issue.index.DefaultIssueDocumentFactory] Indexing issue: STP-998
2017-02-11 13:04:10,755 localhost-startStop-1 DEBUG [jira.issue.index.DefaultIssueDocumentFactory] Indexing issue: STP-997
2017-02-11 13:04:10,772 localhost-startStop-1 DEBUG [jira.issue.index.DefaultIssueDocumentFactory] Indexing issue: STP-996
2017-02-11 13:04:11,453 localhost-startStop-1 INFO [atlassian.jira.startup.IndexRecoveryLauncher] Recover Issue Index - end
2017-02-11 13:04:11,457 localhost-startStop-1 INFO [atlassian.jira.startup.LauncherContextListener] Memory Usage:
---------------------------------------------------------------------------------
 Heap memory : Used: 228 MiB. Committed: 371 MiB. Max: 742 MiB
 Non-heap memory : Used: 209 MiB. Committed: 228 MiB. Max: 1264 MiB
---------------------------------------------------------------------------------
 TOTAL : Used: 436 MiB. Committed: 600 MiB. Max: 2006 MiB
---------------------------------------------------------------------------------
{code}
fields.summary: Recover Issue Index is a blocking and single threaded process (is not a foreground nor background reindex)

fields.description:
*Symptoms:* 

For customers with many users and/or groups adding node to cluster will significantly degrade performance for some time. 

*Root cause:*

Until version 6.4 EagerOfBizGroupCache and  EagerOfBizUserCache used RMIBootstrapCacheLoader to preload their values from different node in the cluster. 
 This loader was making sure that users and groups were preloaded before starting JIRA node in the cluster.
 In version 7.0+ all users and groups are fetched from the database on startup, because those caches replicate puts via value copy all those operations are replicated to all other nodes. This causes significant traffic on cache replication RMI and as a result will slow down entire cluster.  

*Steps to replicate*
 # Create cluster with 20k users and 20k groups.
 # Start first node in the cluster
 # Execute traffic to the cluster
 # Start second node.

Request should be significantly slower for some period of time. The problem will be more significant whit increased number of nodes.
fields.summary: In Data Center users and groups caches are not preloaded on startup

fields.description:
Synopsis: "AWS JIRA DC CloudFormation template does not apply Catalina options when specified. I have tested with quotations around the catalina options and without. They are not applied to the nodes upon creation, nor when the Stack is auto scaled."

 Further investigation: 

Bitbucket's Data Center Template assigned the CatalinaOpts in the bash_profile ([Link to Repo|https://bitbucket.org/atlassian/atlassian-aws-deployment/src/20f93cbcafb52784aba2b2fd2f595ebb7dae219d/templates/BitbucketDataCenter.template?at=master&fileviewer=file-view-default)])
{code:java}
            /home/atlbitbucket/.bash_profile:
              content:
                !Join
                  - "\n"
                  -
                    - if [ -f ~/.bashrc ]; then
                    -     . ~/.bashrc
                    - fi
                    - !Sub ["export CATALINA_OPTS=\"${CatalinaOpts}\"", CatalinaOpts: !Ref CatalinaOpts]
              mode: 000644
              owner: atlbitbucket
              group: atlbitbucket
{code}
JIRA does not seem to set anything for the bash_profile, which is why it is not setting CATALINA OPTS anywhere. The fix would be to follow a similar pattern to creating a .bash_profile with similar CATALINA_OPTS.
fields.summary: JIRA Software Data Center CloudFormation template does not respect CATALINA_OPTS variable on creation

{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-64218].
  {panel}

This for JIRA Cloud

We use JIRA Portfolio's Parent Link field to link JIRA epics (SAFe Features) up to SAFe Epics (custom issue type). 

I need to be able to identify all issues based on their grandparent, and ideally on any other attribute of the JIRA Epic they belong to.

Either live in JQL as sub-queries, or some mechanism to (regularly or on request) to find them and label them so they can be found via that label search.

For example, I want to be able to have a board that showed all issues that were part of any epic whose Parent Link was a specific issue (SAFe Epic)... something like:

{{ "Epic Link" in ("Parent Link" = ABC-53)}}

This of course fails.

I've tried in Cloud using post-function based approaches (standard and JMWE), and have explored most of the add-ons available in cloud, but can't figure out how to do this.

 

This is *fundamental* in our SAFe adoption so we can show all the work supporting a particular SAFe Epic (which may be split across multiple Features in several release trains / programs, and across multiple teams). 

 

Please advise when some workaround of capability will be available in Cloud, or if this can be achieved through a cloud add-on or other approach.
fields.summary: Identify issues based on their Epic's Parent Link or other attribute (sub-queries ideally)

This is not the only case when remote link to Bamboo is created, but it's simplest to reproduce.

fields.description:
h4. Problem
Incremental sync does not work when connecting an application, like Confluence, to JIRA Data Center for user management. The sync will indicate that it is successful, but no user changes/updates would have been applied.
* Problem does not occur when JDC has only a single node.

h4. Steps to Reproduce
* Setup JIRA Data Center with multiple nodes
* Setup JIRA User Server to allow Confluence access
* Connect Confluence to use JIRA as an user directory
* Sync - this will be a Full Sync
* Confirm that this works
* Access JIRA make an user change (ie. rename user, etc.)
* Perform another Sync in Confluence - this will be Incremental Sync
* Notice that the the sync is successful, but user changes did not occur

h4. Cause
* JIRA user change events are populated in cache and is reachable via a REST endpoint:
** Example: http://localhost:8080/rest/usermanagement/1/event/<event-id>
* This cached event list is not replicated across nodes
** Note: user changes are replicated. It is only this event list that is not replicated.
* Confluence and any other application uses this event list to perform incremental changes
** When Confluence connects to JDC and does not connect to the node where user changes occurred, then it will received an incomplete user change event list

h4. Workaround
* Disable incremental sync
fields.summary: Incremental Sync fails when using JIRA Data Center as an User Server

fields.description:
h3. Problem

When viewing the exported CSV file in Excel, the non-english characters aren't rendered correctly.
h3. Steps to Replicate
 # Create an issue with special characters
 # Go to Issue Navigator and click Export > Current fields
 # Open the exported CSV in Excel

h3. Expected Behaviour

The special characters are displayed properly.
h3. Actual Behaviour

Special characters are not correctly rendered. As an example, "phố xưa" is displayed as "phá»‘ xÆ°a" when viewed in Excel.

h3. Workaround

Open the exported CSV file with Notepad++. Under "Encoding", it should be shown File is UTF-8 without BOM. Converting the file to UTF-8 with BOM will allow the file to be displayed correctly in Excel.
Related KB: [Exported CSV does not display properly in Excel that contains non-English characters|https://confluence.atlassian.com/jirakb/exported-csv-does-not-display-properly-in-excel-that-contains-non-english-characters-874626219.html]

h3. Note

Viewing the CSV in text editor works fine.
fields.summary: Non-english Characters Exported via CSV not Rendered Correctly in Excel

h3. Summary
After upgrading JIRA 6.x to 7 with rapid upgrade method, the issue type icons are not updated to the new set of icons.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Set up JIRA 6.4.6 with Agile.
# Take a screenshot of the Administration > Issues > Issue Types page.
# Upgrade the instance to JIRA Software 7.0.0 using the [rapid upgrade method|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/AdminJIRAServer070/Upgrading+JIRA+applications+using+a+rapid+upgrade+method].
# Upon successful upgrade, check out the Issue Types page again and verify if the issue type icons are changed to a different set.
# Restart JIRA and check out the Issue Types page again.

The issue type icons are updated to the new set and remain after restart

h3. Actual Results
The issue type icons revert to the set in JIRA 6.4.6 after restart

Update the icons manually from the UI

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Keyboard Shortcut for (g+g) and (.) will not work while in Issue View page when Inline Edit is disabled.

h3. Environment
* JIRA 7.2+
* Inline Edit is disabled in General Configuration
* On the Issue View page

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Disable Inline Edit
# Got any issue
# Use the shortcut of (.) or (g+g)

h3. Expected Results
The shortcut open nicely on the top, listing possible actions

h3. Actual Results
The below exception is thrown in the "console" tab
{noformat}
batch.js:44441 Uncaught TypeError: issueEditor.getFields is not a function
    at http://localhost:55169/jira727/s/fb3b4413b51668520bf2e8b5866400e6-CDN/fne3b…&sd-kb-panel-enabled=true&sd_operational=true&user-logged-in=true:44441:38
    at http://localhost:55169/jira727/s/075e6c2b48a5b49a623b580ecbf88228-CDN/fne3b…/_super/batch.js?atlassian.aui.raphael.disabled=true&locale=en-US:68350:28
    at Array.map (native)
    at Function.__a031d58c3f1f5e55c1185228c15dd976._.map._.collect (http://localhost:55169/jira727/s/075e6c2b48a5b49a623b580ecbf88228-CDN/fne3b…/_super/batch.js?atlassian.aui.raphael.disabled=true&locale=en-US:42831:62)
    at _.(anonymous function) [as map] (http://localhost:55169/jira727/s/075e6c2b48a5b49a623b580ecbf88228-CDN/fne3b…/_super/batch.js?atlassian.aui.raphael.disabled=true&locale=en-US:43857:49)
    at Class.show (http://localhost:55169/jira727/s/075e6c2b48a5b49a623b580ecbf88228-CDN/fne3b…/_super/batch.js?atlassian.aui.raphael.disabled=true&locale=en-US:68349:18)
    at KeyboardShortcut.eval (eval at _executer (http://localhost:55169/jira727/s/075e6c2b48a5b49a623b580ecbf88228-CDN/fne3b…/_super/batch.js?atlassian.aui.raphael.disabled=true&locale=en-US:79126:24), <anonymous>:2:14)
    at KeyboardShortcut._executer (http://localhost:55169/jira727/s/075e6c2b48a5b49a623b580ecbf88228-CDN/fne3b…/_super/batch.js?atlassian.aui.raphael.disabled=true&locale=en-US:79128:18)
    at HTMLDocument.<anonymous> (http://localhost:55169/jira727/s/075e6c2b48a5b49a623b580ecbf88228-CDN/fne3b…/_super/batch.js?atlassian.aui.raphael.disabled=true&locale=en-US:78918:22)
    at HTMLDocument.keypress (http://localhost:55169/jira727/s/075e6c2b48a5b49a623b580ecbf88228-CDN/fne3b…/_super/batch.js?atlassian.aui.raphael.disabled=true&locale=en-US:78833:37)
{noformat}

h3. Cause

Issue component resolver can serve one of two issue component implementation. There's no 'getFields' function in one of them (IssueViewer). Everything should work if InlineEditParameters is enabled. See below:
!InlineEditParams.png|thumbnail!

h3.Workaround
Enable "Inline Edit" in General Configuration
fields.summary: Keyboard Shortcut Not Working Only In Issue View page

fields.description:
h3. Summary

JIRA 7.3.x startup logs have this warning:
{noformat}
2017-02-15 20:09:18,384 JIRA-Bootstrap WARN      [c.a.j.appconsistency.db.MySqlConnectionUrlCheck] You have an error in your dbconfig.xml file. Missing "default_storage_engine" in connection url. The "storage_engine" parameter is deprecated and should be replaced with  "default_storage_engine".Please refer to the https://docs.atlassian.com/jira/jadm-docs-073/Connecting+JIRA+applications+to+MySQL.
2017-02-15 20:09:20,136 JIRA-Bootstrap INFO      [c.a.jira.startup.DatabaseChecklistLauncher] JIRA database startup checks completed successfully.
{noformat}
The {{dbconfig.xml}} has the entry of:
{code:java}
    <url>jdbc:mysql://127.0.0.1:3306/jiradb?useUnicode=true&characterEncoding=UTF8&sessionVariables=storage_engine=InnoDB</url> 
{code}
The problem is that the warning log is pointing users to [Connecting JIRA applications to MySQL - Atlassian Documentation|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/ADMINJIRASERVER073/Connecting+JIRA+applications+to+MySQL] But that documentation does not explicitly tell users how/where to use the new "default_storage_engine" variable. it is still using the previous 'storage_engine' in all examples and explanations there. I suspect that this replaces the previous/deprecated 'storage_engine', but this document should be updated to reflect the correct settings for JIRA 7.3.x, and update the sample dbconfig.xml on that document.
h3. Environment
 * JIRA 7.3.x and above
 * MySQL database

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Set up JIRA 7.3.x to run with MySQL database as per [Connecting JIRA applications to MySQL - Atlassian Documentation|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/ADMINJIRASERVER073/Connecting+JIRA+applications+to+MySQL].
 # Check the log file during JIRA startup.

h3. Expected Results

JIRA is started with no warning or error for the database connection.
h3. Actual Results

The below exception is thrown in the {{atlassian-jira.log}} file:
{noformat}
2017-02-15 20:09:18,384 JIRA-Bootstrap WARN      [c.a.j.appconsistency.db.MySqlConnectionUrlCheck] You have an error in your dbconfig.xml file. Missing "default_storage_engine" in connection url. The "storage_engine" parameter is deprecated and should be replaced with  "default_storage_engine".Please refer to the https://docs.atlassian.com/jira/jadm-docs-073/Connecting+JIRA+applications+to+MySQL.
2017-02-15 20:09:20,136 JIRA-Bootstrap INFO      [c.a.jira.startup.DatabaseChecklistLauncher] JIRA database startup checks completed successfully.
{noformat}
h3. Workaround

Edit the database URL to:
{noformat}
    <url>jdbc:mysql://127.0.0.1:3306/jiradb?useUnicode=true&characterEncoding=UTF8&sessionVariables=default_storage_engine=InnoDB</url> 
{noformat}
(i) Replace {{storage_engine}} to {{default_storage_engine}}.
fields.summary: update JIRA 7.3 connecting to MySQL database documenation around 'default_storage_engine'

  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-64174].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition
JIRA doesn't connect Epics with their child issues in the Time Tracking report. The relationship between Issues and their sub tasks are shown. 

h3. Suggested Solution
Allow for this relationship to be shown in the report.
fields.summary: As an Admin, I would like the Time Tracking Report to relate between the epic and its child stories
